Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2010 08:52PM ak818 wrote: I had a lumpectomy  and SNB on 8-30.  The SNB incision was really sore compared to the lumpectomy incision. I am now 24 days out and am just beginning to feel normal again. It takes awhile for the soreness to completely go away. I am still sore under my arm, but it is getting better every day. Movment helps with the soreness. Hopefully by now you are feeling much better. I wish you the best of luck!!! Take care!!!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy and SNB after effect questions spitnspunk hmillar

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2010 03:28AM ak818 wrote: I took off a week and a half, but I'm a teacher, so I needed the extra healing time.  I was only really sore the first few days. Your Sentinel Node biopsy, if done with your lumpectomy will be more sore, as your incision will be under your arm. MRI is not a big deal. Mine was an open MRI,  which is not claustrophobic at all.  The worst part for me was not being able to move. I had an IV in my arm the whole time, which wasn't that bad, just a little uncomfortable. I wish you the best of luck. My best advice is to just take one day at a time and surround yourself with support!!!!
